original_title: Locomotive Engineers decide to go on strike for 24-hours
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The Locomotive Operating Engineers' Association of Sri Lanka Railways have declared a 24-hour strike.
The strike will come into effect at midnight on Tuesday (14).

The Locomotive Operating Engineers' Association decided to go on strike in support of the mass strike that will launched by multiple trade unions on Wednesday (15), against the governments unjust tax policy, and several other social issues.

Trade union strike to end on Thursday as President decides to consider demands
Strike at Colombo Port leads to heated exchange with officials, and Navy
